qas.question: What caused the water level in the Yellow River to increase?
Who created a dam in the southern branch of The Yellow River?
What emptied out to the south of the Shandong Peninsula?
What caused the end of Wang Mang's regime?

context: <a0_0>Wang Mang<a0_0/> initiated a series of major reforms that were ultimately unsuccessful. These reforms included outlawing slavery, nationalizing land to equally distribute between households, and introducing new currencies, a change which debased the value of coinage. Although these reforms provoked considerable opposition, Wang's regime met its ultimate downfall with the <a4_0>massive floods<a4_0/> of c. 3 AD and 11 AD. <a1_0>Gradual silt buildup<a1_0/> in the Yellow River had raised its water level and overwhelmed the flood control works. <a3_0>The Yellow River<a3_0/> split into two new branches: one emptying to the north and the other to the south of the Shandong Peninsula, though <a2_0>Han engineers<a2_0/> managed to dam the southern branch by 70 AD.
